# Data process


## Adachi, Kanazawa, Shirakawa, Sendai and Takikawa

### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `tome21` |
|-|-|
| **Label** | `Do you regularly use tobacco, or did you use it in the past?` |
| **Table name** | `jstar_2007_5cities` |
| **Categories:**| `1 = yes, I smoke now` <br/> `2 = I smoked in the past, but I have quit` <br/> `3 = no, I have never smoked regularly` |
| **Missings:**|`NA`|
| **Description** |  |


```{r assign aksst w1, echo=F}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'JSTAR_aksst_w1','JSTAR_datasets_restricted.jstar_2007_5cities', variables=list('tome21'), missings = TRUE)
JSTAR_aksst_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'JSTAR_aksst_w1')
```

```{r local aksst w1, echo=F}
vbl <- JSTAR_aksst_w1$tome21
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(JSTAR_aksst_w1)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(JSTAR_aksst_w1, aes(x=factor(tome21))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `ever_smoked` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `2 into 1` 
* `3 into 0` 
* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo aksst w1}
JSTAR_ds_aksst_w1 <- tibble(id=JSTAR_aksst_w1$id)
JSTAR_ds_aksst_w1$ever_smoked <- car::recode(JSTAR_aksst_w1$tome21, "2 = 1;3 = 0;NA = 999 ")
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript aksst w1, echo=F}
vbl <- JSTAR_ds_aksst_w1$ever_smoked
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(JSTAR_ds_aksst_w1, aes(x=factor(ever_smoked))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation aksst w1, echo=F}
AfterH <- table(JSTAR_ds_aksst_w1$ever_smoked)
X<-table(JSTAR_aksst_w1$tome21)
BeforeH <- c(X[3],sum(X[1:2]),sum(is.na(JSTAR_aksst_w1$tome21)))
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("3->0","1,2->1","NA->999") 
kable(C)
```

## Summary of descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves


Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable.


**R script:**

```{r summ}

l.hds <- list(aksst_w1 = JSTAR_ds_aksst_w1, aksst_w2 = JSTAR_ds_aksst_w2, aksst_w3 = JSTAR_ds_aksst_w3, tn_w1 = JSTAR_ds_tn_w1, tn_w2 = JSTAR_ds_tn_w2, cth_w1 = JSTAR_ds_cth_w1)

for(name in names(l.hds)) {
  aux_object <- l.hds[[name]]
  label(l.hds[[name]][[2]]) <- label(aux_object[[2]]) <- ds_label # Text value assigned at the DS description, at the top
  l.hds[[name]][[2]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[2]], labels = cat_label)
  aux_object[[2]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[2]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
  aux_object[[2]] <- labelled(aux_object[[2]], labels = cat_label[1:2])
  m_name <- paste0("JSTAR_m_ds_",name)
  assign(m_name, aux_object)
  rm(aux_object)
}

t.hds <- frq(l.hds[[1]][2])[[1]][,c(1,2)] 
for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
  t.hds[2+i] <- frq(l.hds[[i]][2])[[1]][,4] 
}
t.hds[13,] <- c("n", "sample size", 
             length(l.hds[[1]][[2]]), length(l.hds[[2]][[2]]) , length(l.hds[[3]][[2]]), length(l.hds[[4]][[2]]), length(l.hds[[5]][[2]]), length(l.hds[[6]][[2]]))
names(t.hds)<-c("val", "label", "AKSST_W1", "AKSST_W2", "AKSST_W3", "TN_W1", "TN_W2", "CTH_W1")
kable(t.hds)

```

```{r save, include=FALSE, echo=F}
for(index in seq_along(l.hds)){

}

```
